node.title: Up to 50,000 cars could enter Queensland tomorrow as state prepares for border reopening
node.alt: Cameron Dick talking to media during a press conference in South Bank
node.description: Queensland has recorded just one case of COVID-19, as the countdown begins forÂ the much-anticipated border reopening.
node.content:
["Queensland has recorded just one case of COVID-19, as the countdown begins for\u00a0the much-anticipated border reopening.", "The case is a\u00a0returned overseas traveller from Nigeria and is\u00a0in hotel quarantine.", "Deputy Chief Health Officer James Smith said health authorities were closely monitoring the case given the Omicron and \"African connection\".", "\"We're very closely following his genomic sequencing results which should be available in the next two days \u2026 obviously very interested whether this maybe Omicron,\" he said.", "It comes as the state prepares to open its borders to COVID\u00a0hotspots from 1am tomorrow.", "Queensland Treasurer Cameron Dick says days of no community cases will soon be over.", "\"These days will be soon as the virus comes to Queensland and the number of cases in our state grows. So the single biggest way we can protect ourselves, our families, Queensland businesses and the Queensland economy is to get vaccinated now,\" he said.", "He said 19 per cent of Queenslanders over 16 years of age were still not fully vaccinated.", "\"Queenslanders can reunite for Christmas and that will be a wonderful thing for Queensland families. But it also means that COVID is coming to Queensland and we've already seen that this week with cases being identified on the Gold Coast,\" he said.", "
Travellers urged to 'pack their patience'
", "Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll\u00a0said it was difficult to estimate how many vehicles would rush to enter Queensland upon the reopening, but suggested the number could be up to 50,000.", "\"It's been very, very difficult to estimate but I could safely say anywhere between 20 to 40 or 50,000 additional vehicles,\" she said", "\"We don't know exactly whether\u00a0people would be coming immediately or will delay the trip for a couple of days.\"", "She is\u00a0urging\u00a0people\u00a0to \"pack their patience\".", "\"Can I ask people to be patient and plan ahead and to travel outside of those peak hours if you can, and to ensure that you do have your border pass,\" she said.", "\"If you can't print it, that's fine. Just make sure that it's\u00a0on your phone.\"", "She asked people to be \"truthful\" on their border declarations.", "\"Many instances we've had, where people have been reported for not being truthful \u2026 as a result there are very heavy fines,\" she said.", "She said police would be out in force in the border area and would be checking compliance.", "Commissioner Carroll said the system would need to be ironed out in the first few days of the change.", "\"It's always it is a bit clunky. It's new, it's different, and a lot of people want to come in at once. So that's why the first couple of days, please particularly be very, very patient,\" she said.", "
Check-in rates falling
", "Dr Smith said testing rates on the Gold Coast had improved after recent incursions.", "\"Over the past 24 hours we've had 11,918 tests done. So that's a reasonable number. We've also seen an uptick in the Gold Coast where we've seen around a doubling in test numbers within Queensland Health facilities over the last couple of days,\" he said.", "", "
Queensland Health says people aren't using the check-in app as much.(ABC News: Chris Gillette)
", "But he reminded Queenslanders to keep using the QR check-in app.", "\"Anecdotally we've heard that people are siphoning off a little bit with regard to checking in and using that check-in app. Really want to remind people to continue to do that,\" he said.", "
Economy in good shape for reopening
", "It came as Mr Dick announced Queensland was leading the nation in terms of job creation, with\u00a0the state's economy \"in good shape\" ahead of tomorrow.", "\"In the 18\u00a0months from March 2020 to September 2021, an extra 90,000 Queenslanders found jobs despite the global pandemic,\" Mr Dick said.", "\"The good news is that trend is set to continue, with Queensland Treasury forecasting almost 120,000 jobs will be created over the 18 months to March 2023.", "\"\u2026 in New South Wales and Victoria 300,000 jobs have been lost since the start of the pandemic.\""]
